intro: Galeatella gloria-montis var. bryanii, commonly known as the Bryan's glory-of-the-morning, is a rare and striking flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its foliage consists of broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery down. Due to its limited distribution and unique appearance, it is highly sought after by botanists and horticulturists alike.
